title: The X jewel,
author: Moncreiff, Fred. Chas.
snippet: I like not to raise hopes in your mind which may be disappointed, but I may tell you that Cockburnspath is but a few miles from Fastcastle.

title: The X jewel,
author: Moncreiff, Fred. Chas.
snippet: to him from Cockburnspath, and I make no doubt that it was stolen in Scotland and taken across the English lines to be sold.

title: Oliver Cromwell's letters and speeches: with elucidations.
author: Cromwell, Oliver
snippet: Cockburnspath with its ravines has been seized onOliver's left, and made impassable ; behind Oliver is the sea ; infront of him Lesley, Doon Hill and the heath-continent of Lammermoor.

title: Oliver Cromwell's letters and speeches: with elucidations.
author: Cromwell, Oliver
snippet: ' Cofperspath,' of which the General here speaks, is the countrypronunciation of Cockburnspath ; name of a wild rock-and-riverchasm, through which the great road goes, some miles to theeastward of Dunbar.

title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr. Alexander Carlyle, Minister of Inveresk,
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: In the preceding winter I had preached three times at Cockburnspath, and was so acceptable to the people that I should have an unanimous call, which was on the point of being moderated when the promise of Inveresk was obtained.

title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr. Alexander Carlyle, Minister of Inveresk,
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: Mr Hay had presented me to Cockburnspath,  and on that I would have been settled.

title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr. Alexander Carlyle, Minister of Inveresk,
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: By this time I had preached thrice at Cockburnspath, and was very acceptable  to the people.

title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr Alexander Carlyle ;
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: In the preceding winter I had preached three times at Cockburnspath, and was so acceptable to the people that I should have an unanimous call, which was on the point of being moderated when the promise of Inveresk was obtained.

title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr Alexander Carlyle ;
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: Mr Hay had presented me to Cockburnspath,  and on that I would have been settled.

title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr Alexander Carlyle ;
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: By this time I had preached thrice at Cockburnspath, and was very acceptable  to the people.

title: Autobiography of the Rev. Dr Alexander Carlyle ;
author: Carlyle, Alexander
snippet: In harvest this year I was presented by John Hay, Esq. of Spot, to the church of Cockburnspath.

title: Recollections of a Visit to Glasgow with the British Archæological Associations, August 27th to September 5th, 1888. With notes
author: Lambert, George
snippet: The venerable Bede fixes the beginning ofthe wall at old Kirkpatrick, notwithstanding that it wasextended to Dunglas between the present Cockburnspath andInnerwick,* and the end to Caerridden on the Frith ofForth, near Abercorn, which in the seventh century was theseat of an English Bishop of the Picts.

title: Early Travellers in Scotland. Edited by P. Hume Brown. [With maps.]
author: Brown, Peter Hume.
